Which part in particular are you confused about? I’d be happy to help with smaller chunks than an entire file.

Looks to me like there are a few methods for changing the state of the intake system, including both updating an english description of what the intake is doing, and coordinating the direction/speed of both its motors.

The best way to work through questions like this is to get as specific as possible. Lay out as best you can what you’ve researched so far. State your assumptions, what you’re sure of. Try to describe where you get less sure, and what you don’t know at all.

It’s easiest for others to try to advance your knowledge by a small step, rather than explain everything and hope they say the thing you need to hear.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-09-12T19:35:15.995Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":45.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471136,"topic_slug":"doubt-in-code","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/doubt-in-code/471136/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3423137,"name":"Arnaud Girard","username":"Arnaud_Girard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/db5fbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-12T19:39:19.571Z","cooked":"

The constructor aka Intake() will create two motor objects and configure them.

The collectIntake() will set intakeState to "Intaking" and set the speed of the front motor of the intake to a its max speed forward with the back one at its max backwards speed.

The invertIntake() will set intakeState to "Inverting" and set the speed of both intake motors to 90% of the max backwards speed.

The stopIntake() will set intakeState to "Stopped" and stop both motors.

The setIntakeState() will manually set intakeState to the value of the parameter.

The periodic() will simply input the intakeState value to the smartDashboard.

Also this is only a comment but you could easily improve your code by changing your intakeState from a String to a enum for improved code readability.

I think the invertIntake deserves a comment in the code to describe why the front is inverted but not the back. And related, it would be instructive to also have a comment on why the front and back motors have opposite rotation to collect. Is it the way the mechanism is designed or because the motors are mounted 180 degrees to each other because of space or mounting limitations?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-09-12T20:21:38.313Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":36.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471136,"topic_slug":"doubt-in-code","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64166,"username":"Arnaud_Girard","name":"Arnaud Girard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/db5fbb/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/doubt-in-code/471136/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3423166,"name":"Arnaud Girard","username":"Arnaud_Girard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/db5fbb/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-12T20:38:10.352Z","cooked":"

The invertIntake() command does indeed have both motors going backwards. I think you mixed up invertIntake() and collectIntake() which indeed has motors going in opposite direction from one another. I admitedly found it strange that the reverse code did not reverse the backIntake motor but did not comment on it as the op’s question was to explain the code. (And if your motors are going at opposite speeds most likely these motors are mounted on opposite sides of an intake.)
